title: Fast approximate Bayesian inference of HIV indicators using PCA adaptive Gauss-Hermite quadrature
summary: This paper introduces Naomi, a spatial evidence synthesis model for producing district-level HIV epidemic indicators in sub-Saharan Africa. It jointly models HIV prevalence, incidence, and antiretroviral therapy coverage using household survey data and routinely reported health system data, providing a tool for countries to generate estimates annually.
